Hello Ibrahim,

The following is a recap of what we tested today:

Last time we tried running FSAA scan for NetAPP target using Local Mode scan with Manual certificates. This was to test if the issue was due to incorrect Hostname in the certificate information.

However, our last test failed with this error:
2025-04-09 12:33:28.5512|DEBUG| 13|Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Https.Internal.HttpsConnectionMiddleware|Failed to authenticate HTTPS connection.
System.IO.IOException: Received an unexpected EOF or 0 bytes from the transport stream.

After speaking with my team we came to conclusion that issue is not caused by incorrect certificates, but instead is caused by an error when Stealth Audit server hostname is checked against this certificate.
Currently it looks like this error is caused due to Stealth Audit server NetBIOS name having more than 15 characters.

To confirm this we did this test today:
We enabled "Automatic" certificates for the local mode scan.
We targeted windows server instead of NetAPP server.

We got exactly the same error after running FSAA job:
Failed to authenticate HTTPS connection.
System.IO.IOException: Received an unexpected EOF or 0 bytes from the transport stream.

This means that it does not matter which certificates we select, or which target host we select - the error is the same.
To resolve this issue for FSAA (Permission) System Scan and FSAC (Activity) System Scan I suggest decreasing the length of NetBIOS name for Stealth Audit server and the FSAA Proxy Server.

We targeted windows server instead of NetAPP server.

Failed to authenticate HTTPS connection.
System.IO.IOException: Received an unexpected EOF or 0 bytes from the transport stream.

This means that it does not matter which certificates we select, or which target host we select - the error is the same.
To resolve this issue for FSAA (Permission) System Scan and FSAC (Activity) System Scan I suggest decreasing the length of NetBIOS name for Stealth Audit server and the FSAA Proxy Server.

Hello Ibrahim, 

Thank you for your time today.
The following is a recap of what we tested today:

Last time we tried running FSAA scan for NetAPP target using Local Mode scan with Manual certificates. This was to test if the issue was due to incorrect Hostname in the certificate information.

However, our last test failed with this error:
2025-04-09 12:33:28.5512|DEBUG| 13|Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Https.Internal.HttpsConnectionMiddleware|Failed to authenticate HTTPS connection.
System.IO.IOException: Received an unexpected EOF or 0 bytes from the transport stream.

After speaking with my team we came to conclusion that issue is not caused by incorrect certificates, but instead is caused by an error when Stealth Audit server hostname is checked against this certificate.
Currently it looks like this error is caused due to Stealth Audit server NetBIOS name having more than 15 characters.

To confirm this we did this test today:
We enabled "Automatic" certificates for the local mode scan.
We targeted windows server instead of NetAPP server.

We got exactly the same error after running FSAA job:
Failed to authenticate HTTPS connection.
System.IO.IOException: Received an unexpected EOF or 0 bytes from the transport stream.

This means that it does not matter which certificates we select, or which target host we select - the error is the same.
To resolve this issue for FSAA (Permission) System Scan and FSAC (Activity) System Scan I suggest decreasing the length of NetBIOS name for Stealth Audit server and the FSAA Proxy Server.
Please, let me know if you have any additional questions or if additional assistance is needed - I am happy to help.
